heisig_constituent: blind, deceased, perish, top hat, fishhook, eye
heisig_story: If one's eyes perish before death, one remains blind for the rest of life.
koohiiStory2: A person with deceased eyes is blind.
jp_example_words: 盲点(もうてん): blind spot
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The death of your eyes means that you've gone blind.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine what it would be like to have one of your eyes die. You'll be blind in that eye forever!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: When you're blind you probably shouldn't drive anymore because if you do you'll mow (もう) everyone over. Actually, don't mow your lawn either. Blind people probably shouldn't be driving anything.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine a blind person mowing over everyone in their car as they drive on the sidewalk. Eeek. At least they don't have to see this mess.

Kanshudo_mnemonic: a dead (亡) eye (目) is blind
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " eye " and " death ", the original meaning is blindness in both eyes. "Said Wen": "There is no Mouzi in the eyes. From the eyes, the sound of death." "Zhuangzi·Xiaoyaoyou": "Why is there deafness and blindness only in Xingwu? Husbands know them."

" Blind " can refer to people who are blind. Han Wangchong's "Lun Heng·Zi Ji": "Those who observe and read, know as if they blindly open their eyes."

" Blind " also means dim. "Xunzi·Fu": "Let's fall to the stars, the night is blind."

" Blind " also means that the description is confused and unreasonable. Tang Hanyu "Dai Zhang Ji and Li Zhedong Book": "Nowadays, there are all blind people."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " eye " and " death ", the original meaning is blindness in both eyes.
humanum_full_description:
從「目」，「亡」聲，本義為雙目失明。《說文》：「目無牟子。从目，亡聲。」《莊子‧逍遙游》：「豈唯形骸有聾盲哉？夫知亦有之。」

　　「盲」可指失明的人。漢王充《論衡‧自紀》：「觀讀之者，曉然若盲之開目。」

　　「盲」也表示昏暗。《荀子‧賦》：「列星殞墜，旦暮晦盲。」

　　「盲」還表示形容糊塗，不明事理。唐韓愈〈代張籍與李浙東書〉：「當今盲于心者皆是。」
humanum_short_description: 從「目」，「亡」聲，本義為雙目失明。

從「 目 」，「 亡 」聲，本義為雙目失明。《說文》：「目無牟子。从目，亡聲。」《莊子‧逍遙游》：「豈唯形骸有聾盲哉？夫知亦有之。」 「 盲 」可指失明的人。漢王充《論衡‧自紀》：「觀讀之者，曉然若盲之開目。」 「 盲 」也表示昏暗。《荀子‧賦》：「列星殞墜，旦暮晦盲。」 「 盲 」還表示形容糊塗，不明事理。唐韓愈〈代張籍與李浙東書〉：「當今盲于心者皆是。」
From the sound of " eye" and " death", the original meaning is blindness in both eyes. "Said Wen": "There is no Mouzi in the eyes. From the eyes, the sound of death." "Zhuangzi·Xiaoyaoyou": "Why is there deafness and blindness only in Xingwu? Husbands know them." " Blind" can refer to people who are blind. Han Wangchong's "Lun Heng·Zi Ji": "Those who observe and read, know as if they blindly open their eyes." " Blind" also means dim. "Xunzi·Fu": "Let's fall to the stars, the night is blind." " Blind" also means that the description is confused and unreasonable. Tang Hanyu "Dai Zhang Ji and Li Zhedong Book": "Nowadays, there are all blind people."

盲字的基本解释

盲
máng
瞎，看不见东西，对事物不能辨认：盲从。盲动。盲目。盲人。盲区（指雷达、探照灯、胃镜等探测或观察不到的区域）。盲流。盲人瞎马（喻处境非常危险）。

盲字的汉语字典释义

[①]［máng］
［《廣韻》武庚切，平庚，明。］
［《集韻》眉庚切，平庚，明。］
(1)目失明。
(2)使失明。
(3)指失明的人。
(4)昏暗。
(5)形容糊涂，不明事理。
(6)见“盲妁”。
(7)见“盲風”、“盲雨”。
[②]［wàng］
［《字彙》巫放切］
亦作“盳1”。通“望1”。

◎ 盲
blind

盲字的康熙字典解释

【午集中】【目字部】　盲； 康熙笔画：8； 页码：页800第01
【唐韻】武庚切【集韻】【正韻】眉庚切【韻會】眉㼱切，?音蝱。【說文】目無牟子。【釋名】盲，茫也，茫茫無所見也。【淮南子·泰族訓】盲者，目形存，而無能見也。　又盲風，疾風也。【禮·月令】仲秋盲風至。　又【正韻】巫放切。與望同。【周禮·天官內饔】豕盲眂而交睫腥。【註】盲，當爲望。【禮·內則】作望視。　又叶謨郞切，莽平聲。【荀况佹詩】天地易位，四時易鄉。列星隕墜，旦暮晦盲。　又叶謨蓬切，音蒙。【老子·道德經】五色令人目盲，五音令人耳聾。【越絕書】內視者盲，反聽者聾。　【集韻】或作瞢朚?。

考證：〔【淮南子·泰俗訓】盲者，目形存，而無能見也。〕　謹按盲者二句見泰族訓，謹照原書改泰族訓。
盲字的源字形

盲字的起名意思

暂无。

blind
Basic explanation of words
blind
máng
Blind, can't see things, can't recognize things: follow blindly. Blind move. Blindly. blind. Blind area (refers to the area that is not detected or observed by radar, searchlight, gastroscope, etc.). Blind flow. Blind people go blind (Yu is in a very dangerous situation).
blind
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①] [máng]
["Guangyun" Wu Gengqie, Ping Geng, Ming. ]
["Ji Yun" Mei Geng cut, Ping Geng, Ming. ]
(1) Blindness.
(2) Make blind.
(3) Refers to blind people.
(4) Dim.
(5) Describe confused and unreasonable.
(6) See "Blind Consort".
(7) See "blind wind" and "blind rain".
[②]［wàng］
["Words" Wu Fangqie]
Also known as "盳1". Pass "Wang 1".

[Afternoon Concentration] [Head and Word Department] 　Blind; Kangxi Strokes: 8; Page Number: Page 800 No. 01
[Tang Yun] Wu Geng cut [Ji Yun] [Zheng Yun] Eyebrow Geng cut [Rhyme] Eyebrow cut,? Yin 蝱. [Said the text] There is no Mouzi. [Release name] Blind, boundless, boundless, see nothing. [Huainanzi·Thai Clan Training] Blind people have their eyesight, but they can't see.　Blind wind, high wind. 【Rite·Moon Order】Blind wind in Zhongqiu.　[Zheng Yun] Wu Fangqie. Same as hope. 【Zhou Li·Tianguan Neiguan】The hog is blindly squinting and has fishy eyelashes. [Note] Blindness should be regarded as hope. 【Li·NeiZe】Look and see.　 Ye Mo cut again, and the voice was flat. [Xun Kuang's Poems] Translocation of heaven and earth, the change of township in the four seasons. The stars fell, and they became blind.　 Ye Mo Pengqie again, Yin Meng. [Laozi·Tao Te Jing] The five colors make people blind, and the five sounds make people deaf. [Yue Jue Shu] The introspective is blind, and the anti-listening is deaf.　【Jiyun】or Zuozhu?. Textual research: 〔【Huainanzi·Tai Suxun】Blind people have their eyesight but can’t see. 〕 　 I would like to see the Thai motto according to the second sentence for the blind, and I would like to change the Thai motto according to the original book.

máng, wàng
I máng прил./наречие
1) слепой, ослепший, лишившийся зрения; вслепую, наобум, наугад
盲干 действовать вслепую (наобум); поступать необдуманно
2) сплошной, глухой (без отверстия)
盲壁 глухая стена
II máng сущ.
1) слепой, слепец
盲哑教育 обучение слепых и глухонемых
2) несведущий человек, не разбирающийся (в какой-л. определённой области, из-за природного недостатка или по незнанию)
盲色 не разбирающийся в цветах, дальтоник
盲文 не знающий иероглифов, неграмотный
3) невежество, неграмотность
扫盲运动 движение за ликвидацию неграмотности
III wàng гл.
смотреть вдаль
盲眂 вглядываться в даль
Radicals: 亡, 目  (death, eye)
Meaning Mnemonic
The death of your eyes means that you've gone blind.
Imagine what it would be like to have one of your eyes die. You'll be blind in that eye forever!
Reading Mnemonic
When you're blind you probably shouldn't drive anymore because if you do you'll mow (もう) everyone over. Actually, don't mow your lawn either. Blind people probably shouldn't be driving anything.
Imagine a blind person mowing over everyone in their car as they drive on the sidewalk. Eeek. At least they don't have to see this mess.
